q:
You are working on an application view and, you wish to show an image that connects with another URL. You use the given command to load the image. However, there occurs an error of "image not found".

<img src="image.jpg" />


Which of the following options would help rectify this issue?

Options

1.

NSString *path = [[NSBundle mainBundle] bundlePath];
NSURL *baseURL = [NSURL fileURLWithPath:path];
[webView loadHTMLString:htmlString baseURL:baseURL];

2.

webView.loadHTMLString("<img src=\"myImg.jpg\">", baseURL: Bundle.main.bundleURL)

3.

let logoImageURL = NSURL(fileURLWithPath: "\(Bundle.main.bundlePath)/PDF_HeaderImage.png")

4.

NSData* data = UIImageJPEGRepresentation(image, 1.0f);

NSString *strEncoded = [data base64Encoding];   

<img src='data:image/png;base64,%@ '/>,strEncoded

You are working on an application that contains a typical type of page for modally indicated view controllers. Moreover, these pages can be closed by moving the given view controller downward.
Which of the following options would help you turn off this downward moment termination?

Options

1.

On ViewDidLoad if your ViewController has been presented within a Navigation Controller:

func viewDidLoad() { 
    self.navigationController?.presentationController?.delegate = self
}

2.

set viewController.isModalInPresentation = false

3.

On ViewDidLoad if your ViewController has been presented within a Navigation Controller:

func viewDidLoad() { 
    self.presentationController?.delegate = self
}

4.

set viewController.isModalInPresentation = true

You are working on an application view where you wish to have a custom background in the cells and want the cells to be seamless. Although, the one-pixel line that remains in-between is causing some problems.
Which of the following options would help you remove the separator line in the table view when in plain mode?

Options

1.

You can change the view by implementing tableView:viewForHeaderInSection: from the UITableViewDelegate protocol.

2.

assign Empty View to tableView FooterView in viewDidLoad

self.tableView.tableFooterView = UIView()

3.

You can do this with the UITableView property separatorStyle. Make sure the property is set to UITableViewCellSeparatorStyleNone

4.

You have to set:
self.tableView.separatorColor = [UIColor clearColor];

You are working on an application that requires a button as given below. You wish to have the exact button design with the same labels and colors.


 Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

You are working on an application view and, you wish to display an image next to a label. Moreover, the label has an inconsistent text length, due to which it is hard to place the image.
Which of the following options would help you place the image correctly?

Options

1.

set the value for yourLabel.intrinsicContentSize.width

2.

CGRect rect = label.frame;
rect.size = [label.text sizeWithAttributes:@{NSFontAttributeName : [UIFont fontWithName:label.font.fontName size:label.font.pointSize]}];
label.frame = rect;

3.

You can add all the attributes you want in sizeWithAttributes. Other attributes you can set:

- NSForegroundColorAttributeName
- NSShadowAttributeName

4.

CGSize expectedLabelSize = [yourString sizeWithFont:yourLabel.font 
                        constrainedToSize:maximumLabelSize 
                        lineBreakMode:yourLabel.lineBreakMode];

You are working on an application view that uses multiple fonts. You wish to change the fonts similar to the system font such that they are thin as compared to the system font.
Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

Passing "system-thin" to UIFont Contructor

2.

You can use system font thin weight:

UIFont.systemFont(ofSize: 34, weight: UIFontWeightThin)

3.

use from targeted element font size. For example:

demoLabel.font = UIFont.systemFont(ofSize: demoLabel.font.pointSize, weight: UIFontWeightThin)

4.

label.font = UIFont.systemFont(ofSize: 15, weight: UIFont.Weight.thin)

You are working on an application view that contains multiple subviews such that images, text fields, buttons, etc. You wish to delete all these subviews from your application by applying the given code.

for (UIView* x in self.view.subviews)
    {
       [x removeFromSuperview];
    }


Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

view.addSubView(UIButton())
view.subviews.forEach { (item) in
     item.removeFromSuperview()
}

2.

func removeAllSubviews() {
        for subview in subviews {
            subview.removeFromSuperview()
        }
    }

3.

[self.view.subviews makeObjectsPerformSelector: @selector(removeFromSuperview)];

4.

extension UIView {
    func removeAllSubviews() {
        subviews.forEach { $0.removeFromSuperview() }
    }
}

You are working on an application view that uses UI buttons. You wish to attach an image to the button such that is does not disturb the scaling of the button.
Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

Just set the ContentMode of the ImageView that is inside the UIButton.

[[self.itemImageButton imageView] setContentMode: UIViewContentModeScaleAspectFit];
[self.itemImageButton setImage:[UIImage imageNamed:stretchImage] forState:UIControlStateNormal];

2.

Adding image to button and using setContentMode:
[self.itemImageButton setImage:stretchImage forState:UIControlStateNormal];

3.

Making a "stretch image":
UIImage *stretchImage = [updatedItem.thumbnail stretchableImageWithLeftCapWidth:0 topCapHeight:0];

4.

You can change .scaleAspectFit (UIViewContentModeScaleAspectFit) to .scaleAspectFill (UIViewContentModeScaleAspectFill) to set an aspect fill mode

You are working on an application that requires a notification panel alert. Moreover, as a new text comes, a notification banner should appear as shown in the given image.


Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

It does not seem to be possible to show the stock iOS notification alert when your app is open and in the foreground.

2.

To show notifications while the app is open, we need to handle it manually.
First, handle calls for notifying then create a view, add AppIcon, Notification message and show it as an animation. At last, add a Touch recognizer to remove if touched or remove in 5 seconds with animation.

3.

When receiving remote notification from the server, you send a local notification and set the value for keyPath: shouldAlwaysAlertWhileAppIsForeground = True

4.

The UNNotificationPresentationOptions flags allow you to specify UNNotificationPresentationOptionAlert to display an alert using the text provided by the notification.

You are working on an application that contains a picker view. You wish to change the height of this view. Although setting a smaller frame does not appear to function also it is locked in the interface builder.
Which of the following options would help you lower the height of this view?

Options

1.

You can use the CGAffineTransformMakeTranslation and CGAffineTransformMakeScale functions to properly fit the picker to your convenience.

2.

You can achieve a change in the height of the view by taking complete control and passing a desired frame size at creation time, e.g:

smallerPicker = [[UIPickerView alloc] initWithFrame:CGRectMake(0.0, 0.0, 320.0, 120.0)];

3.

You can use the following:

UIDatePicker *datePicker = [[UIDatePicker alloc] init];
datePicker.frame = CGRectMake(0, 0, 320, 180);
[self addSubview:datePicker];

4.

An easy way to change the visible height of a picker view is to embed the picker in a UIView, adjust the parent view's height to the height you want to see of the picker, then enable "Clip Subviews" in Interface Builder on the parent UIView or set view.clipsToBounds = true in code.

You are working on an application that contains some spacing before the first section of the view. You wish to modify the default spacing size.
Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

func tableView(_ tableView: UITableView, heightForHeaderInSection section: Int) -> CGFloat {
        if section == 0 {
            return CGFloat.leastNormalMagnitude
        }
        return tableView.sectionHeaderHeight
    }

2.

- (CGFloat)tableView:(UITableView *)tableView heightForHeaderInSection:(NSInteger)section{
    if (section == 0){
        return 0;
    }
    return 10;
}

3.

_tableView.sectionHeaderHeight = 0;
-(CGFloat)tableView:(UITableView *)tableView heightForHeaderInSection:(NSInteger)section{
    return 0;
}

4.

- (CGFloat)tableView:(UITableView *)tableView heightForFooterInSection:(NSInteger)section{
    return CGFLOAT_MIN;
}

You have been working on an application. You wish to make the keyboard disappear when someone touches outside the field view.
Which of the following codes would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

Make your UIView an instance of UIControl (in interface builder) and then connect their TouchUpInside event to dismissKeyboard method. 

2.

Add an UITapGestureRecogniser and assign it to the view, and then call resign the first responder on the UITextField on its selector

3.

Subclass your global view and use hitTest:withEvent method to listen to any touch.

4.

Implement delegate of table view didSelectRowAt

You have been working on an application view that has a button in it. You wish to make sure that the state of that button does not change when someone interacts with it.Which of the following codes would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

set: [button setBackgroundImage:[UIImage imageNamed:@"button_image_selected"] forState:UIControlStateSelected | UIControlStateHighlighted];

2.

You can use:

theButton.adjustsImageWhenHighlighted = YES;

3.

Avoid setting UIButton's Line Break to Clip, instead use the standard Truncate Middle

4.

You can use:

theButton.adjustsImageWhenHighlighted = NO;

You have been working on an application view where you wish to have a cancel button on the right side of the text field to clear the text. Which of the following codes would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

You can add a custom clear button and control the size and everything using this:
textField.clearButtonMode = .whileEditing

2.

You can add custom clear button and control the size and every thing using this:
textField.clearButtonMode = UITextField.ViewMode.whileEditing

3.

This button is a built-in overlay that is provided by the UITextField class

4.

You can add a custom clear button and control the size and everything using this:
UIButton *clearButton = [UIButton buttonWithType:UIButtonTypeCustom];

You have been working on an application view that only has photos in it. You wish to have some spacing on the margins.
Which of the following codes would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

You can use the collectionView:layout:insetForSectionAtIndex: method for your UICollectionView

2.

use setMinimumLineSpacing: and setMinimumInteritemSpacing: on the UICollectionViewFlowLayout-Object.

3.

To add 10px separation between each section just write this

flowLayout.sectionInset = UIEdgeInsetsMake(0.0, 0.0,10,0);

4.

use setMaximumLineSpacing: and setMaximumInteritemSpacing: on the UICollectionViewFlowLayout-Object.

What is the output of the following code:

Code

import UIKit
class ViewController: UIViewController {
    @IBOutlet weak var scrollView: UIScrollView!

    override func viewDidLoad() {
        super.viewDidLoad()

        let contentWidth = scrollView.bounds.width
        let contentHeight = scrollView.bounds.height * 2
        scrollView.contentSize = CGSize(width: contentWidth, height: contentHeight)

        let subviewHeight = CGFloat(120)
        var currentViewOffset = CGFloat(0);

        while currentViewOffset < contentHeight {
            let frame = CGRectMake(0, currentViewOffset, contentWidth, subviewHeight).rectByInsetting(dx: 4, dy: 4)
            let hue = currentViewOffset/contentHeight
            let subview = UIView(frame: frame)
            subview.backgroundColor = UIColor(hue: hue, saturation: 0.5, brightness: 0.5, alpha: 0.5)
            scrollView.addSubview(subview)

            currentViewOffset += subviewHeight
        }
    }
}

a.option: adds a page controller to subviwes into the scroll view
adds a series of differently-colored subviews into the scroll view.
adds a scroll view with auto layout having multi-color background
adds buttons to programatically scroll the contents in the scroll view

q:
You are working on an application view that displays large paragraphs. Moreover, you use the offset margin parameter for paging the text. Which of the following codes would help you remove the margin surrounding the content of this view?

Options

1

UIEdgeInsetsMake(0, -self.textView.textContainer.lineFragmentPadding, 0, -self.textView.textContainer.lineFragmentPadding);

2

UIEdgeInsetsMake(-8,-8,-8,-8);

3

UITextView *textView;
CGSize textSize = [textView usedRectForTextContainer:textView.textContainer].size;

4

textView.textContainer.lineFragmentPadding = 0
textView.textContainerInset = .zero

You are working on an application that has a button functionality. You have two buttons in a single row. When a user presses a button, you would like to give output on that basis. Which of the following code snippet would help you identify which button is tapped?

a.option: give them a .onTapGesture with spacer() between the two buttons
give them a .onTapGesture to have them act essentially
You need to create your own ButtonStyle

What is the output of the given code:

Code

List {
    ForEach(objects) { object in
        ItemRow(item: object)
            .listRowInsets(EdgeInsets())
    }
}

a.option: removes left and right padding of a list
combines items of two diffrent list into one
searches for item in the list

q:
Analyze the given code that generates a list of custom rows. Moreover, you wish to remove the line that appears after each row, keeping the style and padding the same. Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1

List {
                ForEach(self.fruits, id: \.self) { str in
                    CustomRow(text: str)
                        .hideRowSeparator()
                }

2

List {
     .introspectTableView { tableView in
         tableView.separatorStyle = .none
    }

3

List {
    ForEach(items, id:\.self) { 
        Text("Row \($0)")
            .listRowSeparator(.hidden)
    }
}

4

List { <content> }
    .listSeparatorStyle(.none)

What is the output of the given code:

Code

.navigationBarTitle("Try it!", displayMode: .inline)
       .background(NavigationConfigurator { nc in
                nc.navigationBar.barTintColor = .red
      })

Options

1

2

3

4

Your application has text paragraphs that you wish to display by a ScrollView. You encounter a problem while using Scrollview with a VStack inside it. You notice that the resulting text is rendered in single-line. Which of the following options would help you achieve this inside a ScrollView?

Options

1

ScrollView {
      VStack {
               Text("some long paragraph")
                    .lineLimit(nil)
            }.frame(width: UIScreen.main.bounds.width, height: 500)
       }

2

ScrollView {
    VStack {
        Text("some long paragraph")
            .fixedSize(horizontal: false, vertical: true)
    }
}

3

ScrollView {
    VStack {
        Text(longText)
            .lineLimit(nil)
            .font(.largeTitle)
            .frame(idealHeight: .infinity)
    }
}

4

ScrollView {
    VStack(alignment: .leading) {
        Text("some long paragraph")
            .lineLimit(0)
    }.frame(width: UIScreen.main.bounds.width)
}

What is the output of the given code:

Code

@State private var showText = true
    var body: some View {
        VStack {
            Button("Toggle text") {
                showText.toggle()
            }
            if showText {
                Text("Good Day")
            }
        }
    }

a.option: shows the text "good day" when the button is pressed.
creates a button with text "good day"
hides the text "good day" when the button is pressed.
animate the text "good day" when the button is pressed.

q:
You have designed a notes application where you can add daily tasks. You wish to make sure that the list scrolls down as soon as a new task is added to it. Which of the following code snippet accomplishes this task?

Options

1.

ScrollView {
 ForEach(0..<10) { i in
  Text("Example \(i)")
  .frame(width: 300, height: 300)
  .scrollId(i)
  }
 }
}

2.

ScrollView {
 LazyVStack {
  ForEach(messages, id:\.self) { message in
   Text(message)
   Divider()
}}}}

3.

ScrollViewReader { scrollView in
 ScrollView(.vertical) {
 LazyVStack {
  ForEach(notes, id: \.self) { note in
  MessageView(note: note)}}
 .onAppear {scrollView.scrollTo(notes[notes.endIndex - 1])}}}

4.

var scrollView : some View {
  ScrollView(.vertical) {
   ScrollViewReader { scrollView inForEach(self.messages) { msg in
     Text(msg).id(message.id)}

You have an application that requires a button pinned to its edge, just as shown in the image.


Which of the following code snippet would help you accomplish this task?

Code

1.

Button(action: tap) {
 Text("Button")
 .frame(minWidth: 0, maxWidth: .infinity)
 .background(Color.red)
  }
 .padding([.leading, .trailing], 20)

2.

Button(action: {}) {
 Text("MyButton")
 .color(.white)
 .font(Font.system(size: 20))
  }
 .frame(height: 49)
 .background(Color.red, cornerRadius: 0)

3.

Button(action: {}) {
 Text("MyButton")
 .color(.white)
 .font(Font.system(size: 20))
 }
 .frame(minWidth: 0, maxWidth: .infinity)
 .padding(.top, 9)
 .padding(.bottom, 9)
 .background(Color.red, cornerRadius: 0)

4.

Image("myImage")
 .resizable()
 .scaledToFill()
 .frame(maxWidth: .infinity, maxHeight: .infinity)
 .aspectRatio(17.0 / 11.0, contentMode: .fit)

You have multiple views in your application. You wish for each view to have a fixed proportional height compared to the parent view. Considering you have four views such that:
i) The first to be 47% (of its parent's height) high
ii) The second to be 39% (of its parent's height) high
iii) The third to be 24% (of its parent's height) high
iv) The last to be 17% (of its parent's height) high
How would you accomplish this task?

Options

  1. You can make use of VStack. Wrap all the views inside the stack in increasing order of their proportion.
  2. According to this view, the child can propose a size for the parent. The parent then manages itself and creates its size in relation to that proposition.
  3. You can not make custom changes because the layout system sizes each view to be 1/3 high of its parent view.
  4. You can make use of GeometryReader. Wrap the reader around all other views and use its closure value metrics to calculate the heights.

You have to design a button having rounded corners from both ends in your application. However, the button seems to have incomplete borders as shown in the image.


Which of the following code snippet would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

Text("SIGN UP")
 .font(.system(size: 15))
 .fontWeight(.bold)
 .foregroundColor(.white)
 .padding(10)
 .background(RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: 10).stroke().foregroundColor(Color.white))
 .cornerRadius(10)
}

2.

Text("SIGN UP")
 .frame(minWidth: 0, maxWidth: .infinity)
 .font(.system(size: 18))
 .padding()
 .foregroundColor(.white)
 .overlay( RoundedRectangle(cornerRadius: 25)
 .stroke(Color.white, lineWidth: 2))

3.

Button(action: self.action) {
 Text("SIGN UP")
 .font(.system(size: 15))
 .fontWeight(.bold)
 .foregroundColor(.white)
 .padding(10)
 .background(Color.red)
 .cornerRadius(10)}

4.

Button("SIGN UP") { ... }
.tint(.red)
.buttonStyle(.bordered)
.controlSize(.large) 
.controlProminence(.increased)

You have a view that requires a separator line in between two titles. Analyze the given code snippet, it has some errors such that no dark line is displayed on the screen.

EmptyView()

Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

 Text("Hello World")
 Divider()
 Text("Hello Another World")}

2.

HStack {
 line

 line}

3.

 Group { 
  Rectangle() }

You have an application that fetches data from a different application server. You wish to create a content feed that displays images from that server. Analyze the code snippet that has some errors as nothing displays from the image tag.

List(model.posts) { post in
 HStack {
 Text(post.title)
 Image("URL" + post.path)
 Text(post.description)}}

Which of the following option would help you use the URL from the server to display in your application?

Options

1. 

you can use synchronous way such that:
extension URL {
    var image: UIImage? {
        try? UIImage(data: Data(contentsOf: self))
    }
}

2.

you can create a custom image viewer
Button(action: {
 self.onClickImage()
 }, label: {
 CustomNetworkImageView(urlString: self.checkLocalization()) })
 Spacer()
}

3.

you can use asyncImage in this way:
AsyncImage(url: URL(string: "URL"))

4.

Creating CustomImageView:
Image(uiImage: image)
 .resizable()
 .onReceive(imageLoader.$image) { image inself.image = image
 }
 .onAppear {
 imageLoader.loadImage(for: urlString)
}

You are working on an application in which you have to design a text view inside a triangle such that the font size should be automatically set to fit the size of the triangle. Consider the code snippet given.

struct ContentView : View {
  var body: some View {
    ZStack {
     Triangle().strokeBorder(Color.red, lineWidth: 30)
      Text("Text").scaledToFill()
    }
  }
}


Which of the following options would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

Text("Text text text?")
    .padding()
    .background(
       Triangle()
          .strokeBorder(Color.red, lineWidth: 10)
          .scaledToFill()
          .foregroundColor(Color.white))

2.

GeometryReader{g in
    ZStack {
     Triangle().strokeBorder(Color.red, lineWidth: 30)
     Text("Text")
     .font(.system(size: g.size.height > g.size.width ? g.size.width * 0.4: g.size.height * 0.4))
    }
}

3.

var scale = UIScreen.main.bounds.width*0.08
var body: some View {
Text("something").font(.system(size: scale))
}

4.

extension View {
 func fitSystemFont(lineLimit: Int = 1, minimumScaleFactor: CGFloat = 0.01, percentage: CGFloat = 1) -> ModifiedContent<Self, FitSystemFont> {
 return modifier(FitSystemFont(lineLimit: lineLimit, minimumScaleFactor: minimumScaleFactor, percentage: percentage))
   }
}

You have an application that requires a toggle button, just as shown in the image. You wish to change the on-color of the toggle from green to yellow.


Which of the following code snippet would help you accomplish this task?

Options

1.

}
.accentColor(.yellow)

}
.tint(.yellow)

You are working on an application that requires the usage of the LoggedInView function. For that, you are expected to implement some bindings for example an environment object. Which of the following options would help you initialize the binding variable correctly?

Options

1.

struct LoggedInView_Previews : PreviewProvider {
    static var previews: some View {
        LoggedInView(dismissView: **Binding<Bool>(false)**)
    }
}

2.

struct LoggedInView_Previews : PreviewProvider {
    static var previews: some View {
        LoggedInView(dismissView: **Binding<Bool>**)
}}

3.

struct LoggedInView_Previews : PreviewProvider {
    static var previews: some View {
        LoggedInView(dismissView: .constant(false))
    }
}

4.

struct LoggedInView_Previews : PreviewProvider {
    static var previews: some View {
        LoggedInView(dismissView: **Binding<Bool>.init(false)**)
    }
}

Your application has a button that is responsible for an elementary transition. When it is pressed a text message is shown on the center of the screen with simple animation. However, when you run this application the text emerges with a transition but hides back with no animation.
Which of the following options would help you resolve this issue?

Options

  1. You need to explicitly specify the "zIndex" for each view in the stack so they always stay the same
  2. Opacity transitions don't always work so, you have to write it as a custom animation.
  3. You just need add your view in preview in a VStack.
  4. This is a problem with the canvas the animation seems to work in the simulator

Ben is developing an iOS app using UIKit. He has built a music playback app using UIApplicationMain. Which creates the application object and the application delegate of the music app. Also, it sets up the event cycle for the whole lifecycle of the app. Then what parameters are required from the following options?

Parameters

  1. argc
  2. argv
  3. delegateObjectName
  4. principalClassName
  5. delegateClassName
  6. UnsafeMutablePointer

Bob is developing an iOS app using UIKit. He is using UIAdaptivePresentationControllerDelegate for a set of inbuilt methods. Therefore these methods will work in conjunction with a presentation controller and help Bob to determine how to respond to trait changes in your app. Then which correct functions can he use from the following options to make use of the given function?

Options

  1. func adaptivePresentationStyle(for: UIPresentationController, traitCollection: UITraitCollection) -> UIModalPresentationStyle
  2. func adaptivePresentationStyle(for: UIPresentationController) -> UIModalPresentationStyle
  3. func adaptivePresentationStyle(UIPresentationController, viewControllerForAdaptivePresentationStyle: UIModalPresentationStyle) -> UIViewController?
  4. func adaptivePresentationStyle(UIPresentationController, willPresentWithAdaptiveStyle: UIModalPresentationStyle, transitionCoordinator: UIViewControllerTransitionCoordinator?)

What is the output for the following code?

Code

enum BankError: Error {
    case insufficientFunds
    case insufficientInvestors(needed: Int)
    case unknownError
}
func launchbanks(funds: Int, investors: Int) throws
{
    if funds < 999 {
    throw BankError.insufficientFunds
    }
    else if investors < 3 {
    throw BankError.insufficientInvestors(needed: 3)
    }   
    print("3... 2... 1...LAUNCH!!!")
}
do {
    try launchbanks(funds: 5000, investors: 1)
} catch {
    print(error)
}

What is the correct code block to write in place of “//write here” statement among the following options to print output as “Software Engineer".

Code

let employee = ["Name": "Arushi", "Role": "Software Engineer"]
enum Errors: Error {
case NoName
case NoRole
}

//write here

do {
let user = try EmployeeDetails(names: employee)
print("Result: \(user)")
} catch Errors.NoName {
print("Name doesn't exists")
} catch Errors.NoRole {
print("Role doesn't exists")
}

Options

1.

func EmployeeDetails(names: [String: String]) throws -> String {
guard let getdetails = names[""] else {
throw Errors.NoName
}
return getdetails
}

2.

func EmployeeDetails(names: [String: String]) throws -> String {
guard let getdetails = names["Role"] else {
throw Errors.NoName
}
return getdetails
}

3.

func EmployeeDetails(names: [String: String]) throws -> String {
return names["Name"]
}

4.

func EmployeeDetails(names: [String: String]) throws -> String {
guard let getdetails = names["Name"] else {
throw Errors.NoName
}
return getdetails
}

Suppose there is a product which is subdivided into two kinds: food and thing. Anything that is eatable is food else it is a thing. Let the product be the class with enumerations defined as food and thing. By default, the kind variable will be a thing.

Using the canEat() function, the kind will be changed to food for each instance. The name of the instance is “banana”. Now, choose the best suitable option from below with respect to the mentioned scenario.

Options

1.

kind variable has the function scope
product class has the class scope
canEat() class has the class scope

2.

kind variable has the class scope
product class has the class scope
canEat() class has the class scope

3.

kind variable has the class scope
product class has the global scope
canEat() class has the function scope

4.

kind variable has the global scope
product class has the global scope
canEat() class has the function scope

What is the output of the following Swift code?

Code

import Foundation
func function( strarray: [String]) -> String {
    if strarray.count == 0 {
    return ""
    }
    var s = strarray[0]
    
    for str in strarray {
    while !str.hasPrefix(s) && !s.isEmpty{
    s = String(s.dropLast())
    }
    }
    return s
}
var strs=["Swift arrays","Swift strings","Swift functions"]
print(function(strarray:strs))

a.option: Swift arrays Swift strings Swift functions

Code

func revstring(string: String) -> String
{
    var value = ""
    msg=string
    for c in msg {
    value = String(c) + value
    }
    msg=value
    return value
}

print(value)
print(msg)

swift

Code

func function(a: Int) {
var Number=0, Temp=0, Reminder=0, Reverse = 0;
Number=a;
Temp = Number;
while ( Temp > 0)
{
Reminder = Temp % 10
Reverse = Reverse * 10 + Reminder
Temp = Temp / 10
}
print(Reverse);
if ( Number == Reverse ){
print("Yes");
}
else{
print("No");
}
}
function(a:1011);

Options

1.

1101
No

2.

1001
Yes

3.

1001
No

4.

1101
Yes

What is the output of the following Swift code?

Code

enum Rainbow : Int {
    case Violet = 1, Indigo, Blue, Green, Yellow, Orange, Red
    static let RainbowInWL : [Rainbow : Int] = 
    [Violet : 400, Indigo : 450, Blue: 490, Green : 570, Yellow : 590, Orange: 620, Red: 650]
    static func wavelengthForRainbow(color : Rainbow) -> Int? {
    if let wavelength = RainbowInWL[color] {
    printWL(color: color, colorWL: wavelength)
    return wavelength
    } else {
    return nil
    }
    }
    static func printWL(color: Rainbow, colorWL : Int) {
    print("The wavelength for \(color) is " +
    "\(colorWL) nm.")
    }
}
let color = Rainbow.wavelengthForRainbow(color:.Blue)

a.option: The wavelength for Blue is 450 nm.
The wavelength for Blue is 490 nm.
The wavelength for Blue is 400 nm.

q:
What is the output of the following Swift code?

Code

let value = 14
var count=0
switch value {
    case 0...5:
    count=value*2;

    case 6...10:
    count=value+2;

    case 11...15:
    count=value/2;
    
    case 16...20:
    count=value-2;

    default:
    count=value;
}
var i=0
var result=0
while(i    if(i>=5){
    result-=1;
    }
    else{
    result+=2;
    }
    i+=1;
}
print(result);

q:
Which of the following options correctly denotes the output of the following code snippet?

Code

struct Square {
    var side:Int = 5
}
protocol MakeShape {
    func makeShape(_ s: Square)
    func preferredSize() -> Int
}
class Polygon
{
    var delegate:MakeShape?
    func makepolygon()
    {
    var s = Square()
    s.side = delegate?.preferredSize() ?? 6
    delegate?.makeShape(s)
    }
}
class PolygonMaker: MakeShape
{
    func makeShape(_ s: Square)
    {
    print("Square of size \(s.side) was created.")
    }
    func preferredSize() -> Int
    {
    return 7
    }
}
let pen = PolygonMaker()
let pencil = Polygon()
pencil.delegate = pen
pencil.makepolygon()

Which of the following options correctly denotes the output of the following code snippet?

Code

struct Square {
    var s:Int = 5
}
protocol MakeShape {
    func makeShape(_ s: Square)
}
class Polygon
{
    var delegate:MakeShape?

    func makepolygon()
    {
    var side = Square()
    side.s = 6

    delegate?.makeShape(side)
    }
}
class PolygonMaker: MakeShape
{
    func makeShape(_ side: Square)
    {
    print("Square of size \(side.s) was created.")
    }
}
let pen = PolygonMaker()
let pencil = Polygon()
pencil.delegate = pen
pencil.makepolygon()

}
class ToyShop
{

    func makeToy()
    {

    delegate?.toyWasMade(toy)
    }
}

{

    {

    }
}

toyshop.delegate = shop
toyshop.makeToy()

    self.Hindi = Hindi

full = Marks(English: 98, Hindi: 150)

2.

R.marks.English = 98

3.

R = Student(id: "R543", marks: new)

4.

R.Student.Marks.English = 98

q:
Which options correctly denotes the output of the following code?

Code:

import Foundation
extension String{
    func replace(_ dictionary: [String: String]) -> String{
    var result = String()
    var i = -1
    for (of , with): (String, String)in dictionary{
    i += 1
    if i<1{
    result = self.replacingOccurrences(of: of, with: with)
    }else{
    result = result.replacingOccurrences(of: of, with: with)
    }
    }
    return result
    }
    }
let mobile = "+1 (800) 444-9999"
let dictionary = ["+": "00", " ": "", "(": "", ")": "", "-": ""]
let mobileResult = mobile.replace(dictionary)
print(mobileResult)

Code

struct ContentView: View {
    @State private var showingAlert = false

        Button("Show Alert") {
            showingAlert = true
        }
        .alert(isPresented: $showingAlert) {
            Alert(title: Text("Alert!"), message: Text("Someone entered your personal Workroom"), dismissButton: .default(Text("Got it!")))
        }
    }
}
